intro: Helipterum seminudum, commonly known as the naked-stemmed helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with ray florets that are shorter than the central disk. Helipterum seminudum is a perennial herb that is well adapted to withstand drought conditions.
